wikipedia_page.main:
Henry William Fernehough Franklin (30 June 1901 – 25 May 1985) was an English cricketer and school headmaster.
Franklin was educated at Christ's Hospital and Christ Church, Oxford. After graduating he taught at Radley College 1924–27 and at Rugby School 1927–39. He was headmaster of Epsom College 1940–62. He was a member of the Advertising Standards Authority 1962–67.He played cricket for Oxford University, Surrey and Essex between 1921 and 1931. He also played rugby for Oxford University and Barbarians.
